description: Remember EVERYTHING. Knowledge graphs, cross-session memory, smart caching. Cut token costs by 73% instantly.

prompts.name: knowledge_graph_builder
prompts.description: Build and maintain a knowledge graph of all information
prompts.template:
Maintain a knowledge graph structure:

```
ENTITIES:
[E1] Name | Type | Attributes
     └─ Related: [E2](relationship), [E3](relationship)

[E2] Name | Type | Attributes
     └─ Related: [E1](relationship)
```

Entity types:
- PERSON: name, role, preferences, contact
- PROJECT: name, status, deadline, stakeholders
- CONCEPT: definition, related concepts
- DECISION: what, when, why, alternatives considered
- FILE: path, purpose, last modified
- SYSTEM: name, purpose, access method

Relationship types:
- owns, manages, works_on
- depends_on, blocks, enables
- is_part_of, contains
- contradicts, supports

Update graph on every new information. Query graph before re-asking user.

prompts.name: context_compression
prompts.description: Compress conversation history to minimize tokens
prompts.template:
Every 10 messages, compress the conversation context:

1. EXTRACT lasting information → move to knowledge graph
2. SUMMARIZE decisions and outcomes (discard deliberation)
3. REMOVE resolved questions and their answers
4. KEEP only:
   - Active goals/tasks
   - Unresolved questions
   - Recent corrections/preferences
   - Essential context for current work

Compression format:
```
=== COMPRESSED CONTEXT ===
GOALS: [active goals]
WORKING ON: [current task]
KEY DECISIONS: [list]
OPEN QUESTIONS: [list]
RECENT PREFERENCES: [list]
=========================
```

Target: 73% reduction in context size

prompts.name: smart_cache
prompts.description: Cache frequently accessed information for instant retrieval
prompts.template:
Maintain a hot cache of frequently accessed information:

```
HOT CACHE (instant access):
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
[KEY] → [VALUE] | Hits: N | Last: timestamp

Cache rules:
- Max 20 items in hot cache
- Promote on access (LRU)
- Demote after 10 messages without access
- Always cache: user name, project name, key preferences
```

Cache triggers:
- Second access to same info → add to cache
- User correction → update cache immediately
- 'Remember this' → force add to cache

Before asking user, check:
1. Hot cache
2. Knowledge graph
3. Compressed context
Only ask if not found in any.

prompts.name: cross_session_memory
memory_retrieval
prompts.template:
When information is needed, use tiered retrieval:

TIER 1 - Instant (hot cache):
- Check cache first
- O(1) retrieval
- No token cost

TIER 2 - Fast (knowledge graph):
- Query by entity or relationship
- Follow graph connections
- Minimal token cost

TIER 3 - Search (compressed context):
- Keyword search in compressed history
- Higher token cost
- Use only if T1/T2 fail

TIER 4 - Ask user:
- Only after T1-T3 fail
- Explain what was searched
- Store answer for future

Never jump to T4 without checking T1-T3.
